WDT - Watchdog Timer Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides watchdog timer functionality for Apollo5 devices, supporting system monitoring, fault detection, and automatic recovery mechanisms. It enables reliable system operation through configurable timeout periods, interrupt generation, and reset capabilities.

Key Features

  1. System Reset: Automatic system reset on timer expiration.
  2. Interrupt Support: Configurable interrupt generation before reset.
  3. Flexible Timing: Multiple clock sources and timing configurations.
  4. Lock Protection: Optional configuration locking for security.
  5. Status Monitoring: Real-time timer status and value reading.

Functionality

  • Configure watchdog timer parameters and clock sources
  • Start, stop, and restart watchdog operations
  • Handle watchdog interrupts and status monitoring
  • Support for configuration locking and protection
  • Read timer values and monitor system health

Usage

  1. Configure the watchdog using am_hal_wdt_config()
  2. Start the watchdog with am_hal_wdt_start()
  3. Service the watchdog periodically to prevent reset
  4. Handle watchdog interrupts if enabled
  5. Monitor watchdog status as needed

Configuration

  • Clock Sources: Select from LFRC-based clock options
  • Timing Values: Configure interrupt and reset timing
  • Interrupts: Enable/disable watchdog interrupts
  • Reset Control: Enable/disable system reset on timeout

void * pvConfig )

Configure the watchdog timer.

Parameters
eTimerselects the desired watchdog timer.
pvConfigis a pointer to a configuration structure for the timer.

This function applies a configuration to the selected watchdog timer.

Returns
WDT status code.

◆ am_hal_wdt_interrupt_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_wdt_interrupt_enable ( am_hal_wdt_select_e eTimer,
uint32_t ui32InterruptMask )

Watchdog interrupt enable.

Parameters
eTimerselects the desired watchdog timer.
ui32InterruptMaskis an OR'ed together set of interrupts.

Enables a set of interrupts for a specific watchdog TIMER.

Note
Each WDT instance has its own interrupt register. This function cannot access more than one register at once. If you want to interact with more than one interrupt, you will need to call this function more than once.

For example:

// RIGHT
am_hal_wdt_interrupt_enable(AM_HAL_WDT_MCU,
AM_HAL_WDT_INTERRUPT_MCU);
am_hal_wdt_interrupt_enable
uint32_t am_hal_wdt_interrupt_enable(am_hal_wdt_select_e eTimer, uint32_t ui32InterruptMask)
Watchdog interrupt enable.

AM_HAL_WDT_INTERRUPT_MCU
#define AM_HAL_WDT_INTERRUPT_MCU
Definition am_hal_wdt.h:127
AM_HAL_WDT_MCU
@ AM_HAL_WDT_MCU
Definition am_hal_wdt.h:77
Returns
WDT status code.

Check to see which WDT interrupts are enabled.

Parameters

pui32InterruptMaskreturns the set of enabled interrupts for the selected timer.

This function returns the set of enabled interrupts for a specific watchdog timer.

WDT status code.

uint32_t * pui32Value )

Reads the watchdog timer's current value.

Parameters

WDT status code.

◆ am_hal_wdt_restart()

uint32_t am_hal_wdt_restart ( am_hal_wdt_select_e eTimer)

Restart (pet/feed) the watchdgog.

Parameters
eTimerselects the desired watchdog timer.

This funtion forces the watchdog timer to start over from its beginning value. The key value is supplied manually to help mitigate the risk of accidental watchdog restarts due to runaway code.

Returns
WDT status code.

◆ am_hal_wdt_start()

uint32_t am_hal_wdt_start ( am_hal_wdt_select_e eTimer,
bool bLock )

Enables the watchdog timer.

Parameters
eTimerselects the desired watchdog timer.
bLockcan be used to lock the watchdog.

This function will start the selected watchdog timer. If the bLock parameter is set, for the correct watchdog instance, it will also activate the LOCK register. Once a watchdog is enabled and locked, its configuration cannot be changed until a device reset.

Returns
WDT status code.

◆ am_hal_wdt_stop()

uint32_t am_hal_wdt_stop ( am_hal_wdt_select_e eTimer)

Disables the watchdog timer.

Parameters
eTimerselects the desired watchdog timer.

This function will stop the selected watchdog. It will not work if the WDT is already locked.

Returns
WDT status code.
